title: Addition and subtraction
subject: Arithmetic
description: In this topic  we will add and subtract whole numbers. The topic starts with 1+1=2 and goes through adding and subtracting within 1000.  We will cover regrouping  borrowing  and word problems.

title: Multiplication and division
subject: Arithmetic
description: In this topic  we will multiply and divide whole numbers. The topic starts with 1-digit multiplication and division and goes through multi-digit problems.  We will cover regrouping  remainders  and word problems.

title: Negative numbers
subject: Arithmetic
description: Learn about numbers below 0 and how they relate to positive numbers.  Add  subtract  multiply and divide negative numbers.

title: Fractions
subject: Arithmetic
description: In this topic  we will explore fractions conceptually and add  subtract  multiply  and divide fractions.

title: Decimals
subject: Arithmetic
description: In this topic  we will learn what a decimal is and how to show it visually and on a number line.  We will also add  subtract  multiply  and divide with decimals.

title: Arithmetic properties
subject: Pre-algebra
description: This tutorial will help us make sure we can go deep on arithmetic. We'll explore various ways to represent whole numbers  place value  order of operations  rounding and various other properties of arithmetic.

title: Factors and multiples
subject: Pre-algebra
description: Understanding and finding factors and multiples. After these videos  you'll be ready for fractions.

title: Reading and interpreting data
subject: Pre-algebra
description: This topic is less about statistics and more about interpreting data--whether it is presented as a table  pictograph  bar graph or line graph.  Good for someone new to these ideas.  For a student in high school or college looking to learn statistics  it might make sense to skip (although it might not hurt either).

title: Measurement
subject: Pre-algebra
description: From length to area to volume to time  thinking about how we measure things.

title: Fractions
subject: Pre-algebra
description: Understanding fractions conceptually  using operations with fractions  and converting fractions.

title: Decimals
subject: Pre-algebra
description: Understanding decimals conceptually  using operations with decimals  rounding and estimating with decimals  and converting decimals.

title: Negative numbers and coordinate plane
subject: Pre-algebra
description: Extending our understanding of numbers below 0.  Thinking about "absolute" distance from 0.  We will also look at all 4 quadrants on the coordinate plane.

title: Ratios rates proportions
subject: Pre-algebra
description: Learn all about proportional relationships. How are they connected to ratios and rates? What do their graphs look like? What types of word problems can we solve with proportions?

title: Equations expressions and inequalities
subject: Pre-algebra
description: In this topic  we will look at 1- and 2-step equations  as well as expressions and inequalities.

title: Exponents radicals and scientific notation
subject: Pre-algebra
description: Understanding and solving exponents  radicals  and scientific notation without algebra.

title: Counting
subject: Early math
description: Learn how to count. Say how many objects you see.

title: Addition and subtraction intro
subject: Early math
description: Learn the basics of adding and subtracting.

title: Place value (tens and hundreds)
subject: Early math
description: Learn about tens and hundreds. Compare 2-digit and 3-digit numbers.

title: Addition and subtraction within 20
subject: Early math
description: Learn to add and subtract numbers that are 20 or less.

title: Addition and subtraction within 100
subject: Early math
description: Learn to add and subtract two-digit numbers within 100.

title: Addition and subtraction within 1000
subject: Early math
description: Learn to add and subtract two- and three-digit numbers within 1000.

title: Measurement and data
subject: Early math
description: Learn how to measure length  tell time  count money  and make graphs.

title: Geometry
subject: Early math
description: Learn about triangles  circles  rectangles  and other shapes.

title: Introduction to algebra
subject: Algebra I
description: This topic is an overview of the fundamental ideas and tools of algebra.

title: One-variable linear equations
subject: Algebra I
description: Learn how to solve linear equations that contain a single variable. For example  solve 2(x+3)=(4x-1)/2+7.

title: One-variable linear inequalities
subject: Algebra I
description: Learn how to solve linear inequalities with a single variable. For example  solve -3(x+1)>2x-7. Learn how to solve compound inequalities. For example  solve 2x+1>3 AND -x-5<4.

title: Units of measurement in modeling
subject: Algebra I
description: Modeling is an amazing world  full of challenges. In this topic  we will start to think about some general modeling concerns  before we dive into modeling situations with different kinds of functions and equations throughout the Algebra curriculum.

title: Two-variable linear equations
subject: Algebra I
description: Learn about linear equations that contain two variables  and how these can be represented by graphical lines and tables of values.

title: Functions
subject: Algebra I
description: Functions are mathematical entities that assign unique outputs to given inputs. Sounds simple? Think again!  In this topic you will evaluate  graph  analyze  and create various types of functions.

title: Linear equations and functions word problems
subject: Algebra I
description: Solve various word problems that involve real world relationships that can be represented by linear equations or functions.

title: Sequences
subject: Algebra I
description: Learn about the various ways in which we can define sequences; Use and construct arithmetic and geometric sequences.

title: Systems of linear equations
subject: Algebra I
description: Learn how to interpret solutions to systems of linear equations and solve them.

title: Two-variable linear inequalities
subject: Algebra I
description: In this topic  we study inequalities like x+2y>5 and graph them. This helps us see their solutions. We also explore systems of inequalities (multiple inequalities at the same time) and use them to describe real-world situations.

title: Absolute value & piecewise functions
subject: Algebra I
description: Learn how to solve absolute value equations and how to graph absolute value functions.

title: Expressions with rational exponents and radicals
subject: Algebra I
description: Learn about expressions with rational exponents like x^(2/3)  about radical expressions like √(2t^5)  and about the relationship between these two forms of representation. Learn how to evaluate and simplify such expression.

title: Introduction to exponential functions
subject: Algebra I
description: Learn how to construct  analyze  graph  and interpret basic exponential functions of the form f(x)=a*r^x.

title: Introduction to polynomials
subject: Algebra I
description: Learn how to add  subtract  and multiply polynomial expressions. For example  write (2x+3)(x-1) as 2x²+x-3.

title: Polynomial factorization
subject: Algebra I
description: Learn how to write polynomial expressions as the product of linear factors. For example  write x^2+3x+2 as (x+1)(x+2).

title: Quadratic equations and functions
subject: Algebra I
description: Learn how to solve quadratic equations  and how to analyze and graph quadratic functions.

title: Rational and irrational numbers
subject: Algebra I
description: Learn about irrational numbers and how to identify them.

title: Geometry foundations
subject: High school geometry
description: Review your knowledge about angles  triangles  quadrilaterals  and area.

title: Transformations
subject: High school geometry
description: In this topic you will learn about the most useful math concept for creating video game graphics: geometric transformations  specifically translations  rotations  reflections  and dilations.  You will learn how to perform the transformations  and how to map one figure into another using these transformations.

title: Congruence
subject: High school geometry
description: Learn what it means for two figures to be congruent  and how to determine whether two figures are congruent or not. Use this immensely important concept to prove various geometric theorems about triangles and parallelograms.

title: Similarity
subject: High school geometry
description: Learn what it means for two figures to be similar  and how to determine whether two figures are similar or not. Use this concept to prove geometric theorems and solve some problems with polygons.

title: Right triangles & trigonometry
subject: High school geometry
description: Triangles are not always right (although they are never wrong)  but when they are it opens up an exciting world of possibilities.  Not only are right triangles cool in their own right (pun intended)  they are the basis of very important ideas in analytic geometry (the distance between two points in space) and trigonometry.

title: Solid geometry
subject: High school geometry
description: Extend your knowledge about two-dimensional shapes to three dimensions!

title: Analytic geometry
subject: High school geometry
description: In analytic geometry  also known as coordinate geometry  we think about geometric objects on the coordinate plane. For example  we can see that opposite sides of a parallelogram are parallel by writing a linear equation for each side and seeing that the slopes are the same.

title: Circles
subject: High school geometry
description: Explore  prove  and apply important properties of circles that have to do with things like arc length  radians  inscribed angles  and tangents.

title: Trigonometry with right triangles
subject: Trigonometry
description: Learn the basics of trigonometry: What are sine  cosine  and tangent? How can we use them to solve for unknown sides and angles in right triangles?

title: Trigonometry with general triangles
subject: Trigonometry
description: Learn how to use trigonometry in order to find missing sides and angles in any triangle.

title: The unit circle definition of sine cosine and tangent
subject: Trigonometry
description: Learn how the trigonometric ratios are extended to all real numbers using algebra. Start solving simple problems that involve this new definition of the trigonometric functions.

title: Graphs of trigonometric functions
subject: Trigonometry
description: Learn how to graph trigonometric functions and how to interpret those graphs. Learn how to construct trigonometric functions from their graphs or other features.

title: Trigonometric equations and identities
subject: Trigonometry
description: Learn how to solve trigonometric equations and how to use trigonometric identities to solve various problems.

title: Trigonometric equations and identities
subject: Precalculus
description: Learn how to solve trigonometric equations and how to use trigonometric identities to solve various problems.

title: Conic sections
subject: Precalculus
description: Learn about the four conic sections and their equations: Circle  Ellipse  Parabola  and Hyperbola.

title: Vectors
subject: Precalculus
description: Learn what vectors are and how they can be used to model real-world situations. Perform various operations with vectors like adding  subtracting  scaling  conversion between rectangular to polar coordinates  etc.

title: Matrices
subject: Precalculus
description: Learn what matrices are and about their various uses: solving systems of equations  transforming shapes and vectors  and representing real-world situations. Learn how to add  subtract  and multiply matrices  and find the inverses of matrices.

title: Imaginary and complex numbers
subject: Precalculus
description: Use your imagination and complexity (?) and dive into the world of complex numbers. Add  subtract  multiply  & divide complex numbers. Plot them on the complex plane and convert between rectangular and polar forms.

title: Probability and combinatorics
subject: Precalculus
description: Basics of probability and combinatorics

title: Sequences series and induction
subject: Precalculus
description: An assortment of concepts in math that help us deal with sequences and proofs.

title: Displaying and describing data
subject: Statistics and probability
description: One of the first things we do in statistics is try to understand sets of data. This involves plotting the data in different ways and summarizing what we see with measures of center (like mean and median) and measures of spread (like range and standard deviation). This topic focuses on concepts that are often referred to as "descriptive statistics".

title: Modeling distributions of data
subject: Statistics and probability
description: The normal distribution is the most commonly used model in all of statistics. Learn how to measure position using z-scores and find what percent of data falls where in a normal distribution.

title: Describing relationships in quantitative data
subject: Statistics and probability
description: If we want to explore a relationship between two quantitative variables  we make a scatterplot of the data. The fun doesn't stop there. We describe pattern  talk about the type of correlation we see  and sometimes fit a line to the data so we can use the pattern to make predictions.

title: Designing studies
subject: Statistics and probability
description: Study design focuses on collecting data properly and making the most valid conclusions we can based on how the data was collected. This topic covers explore samples  surveys  and experiments.

title: Probability
subject: Statistics and probability
description: Probability tells us how often some event will happen after many repeated trials. This topic covers theoretical  experimental  compound probability  permutations  combinations  and more!

title: Random variables
subject: Statistics and probability
description: Random variables can be any outcomes from some chance process  like how many heads will occur in a series of 20 flips. We calculate probabilities of random variables and calculate expected value for different types of random variables.

title: Sampling distributions
subject: Statistics and probability
description: A sampling distribution shows every possible result a statistic can take in every possible sample from a population and how often each result happens. This topic covers how sample proportions and sample means behave in repeated samples.

title: Confidence intervals (one sample)
subject: Statistics and probability
description: Confidence intervals give us a range of plausible values for some unknown value based on results from a sample. This topic covers confidence intervals for means and proportions.

title: Significance tests (one sample)
subject: Statistics and probability
description: Significance tests give us a formal process for using sample data to evaluate the likelihood of some claim about a population value. We calculate p-values to see how likely a sample result is to occur by random chance  and we use p-values to make conclusions about hypotheses.

title: Significance tests and confidence intervals (two samples)
subject: Statistics and probability
description: Learn how to apply what you know about confidence intervals and significance tests to situations that involve comparing two samples to see if there is a significant difference between the two populations.

title: Inference for categorical data (chi-square tests)
subject: Statistics and probability
description: Chi-square tests are a family of significance tests that give us ways to test hypotheses about distributions of categorical data. This topic covers goodness-of-fit tests to see if sample data fits a hypothesized distribution  and tests for independence between two categorical variables.

title: Advanced regression (inference and transforming)
subject: Statistics and probability
description: Advanced regression will introduce you to regression methods when data has  a nonlinear pattern.

title: Analysis of variance (ANOVA)
subject: Statistics and probability
description: Analysis of variance  also called ANOVA  is a collection of methods for comparing multiple means across different groups.

title: Limits basics
subject: AP Calculus AB
description: Limits are intuitive  yet elusive. Learn what they are all about and how to find limits of functions from graphs or tables of values. Learn about the difference between one-sided and two-sided limits and how they relate to each other.

title: Continuity
subject: AP Calculus AB
description: Continuous functions are  in essence  functions whose graphs can be drawn without lifting up your pen. This may sound simple  but this is in fact a very rich subject. Learn how continuity is defined using limits  and about a main property of all continuous functions -- the Intermediate value theorem.

title: Limits from equations
subject: AP Calculus AB
description: Now that we have all the conceptual stuff laid down  we can start have some fun with finding limits of various functions. Some of these limits don't want you to find them so fast  but we're sure you'll get them in the end!

title: Infinite limits
subject: AP Calculus AB
description: Basically  a limit must be at a specific point and have a specific value in order to be defined. Nevertheless  there are two kinds of limits that break these rules. One kind is unbounded limits -- limits that approach ± infinity (you may know them as "vertical asymptotes"). The other kind is limits at infinity -- these limits describe the value a function is approaching as x goes to ± infinity (you may know them as "horizontal asymptotes").

title: Derivative introduction
subject: AP Calculus AB
description: Get comfortable with the big idea of differential calculus  the derivative. The derivative of a function has many different interpretations and they are all very useful when dealing with differential calculus problems. This topic covers all of those interpretations  including the formal definition of the derivative and the notion of differentiable functions.

title: Basic differentiation
subject: AP Calculus AB
description: Differentiating functions is not an easy task! Make your first steps in this vast and rich world with some of the most basic differentiation rules  including the Power rule. It will surely make you feel more powerful.

title: Product quotient & chain rules
subject: AP Calculus AB
description: Covered basic differentiation? Great! Now let's take things to the next level. In this topic  you will learn general rules that tell us how to differentiate products of functions  quotients of functions  and composite functions. Anxious to find the derivative of eˣ⋅sin(x²)? You've come to the right place.

title: Differentiating common functions
subject: AP Calculus AB
description: Now that you know all the important differentiation rules  let's solve some problems that involve the differentiation of various common functions.

title: Advanced differentiation
subject: AP Calculus AB
description: The chain rule sets the stage for implicit differentiation  which in turn allows us to differentiate inverse functions (and specifically the inverse trigonometric functions). This is really the top of the line when it comes to differentiation.

title: Analyzing functions with calculus
subject: AP Calculus AB
description: Let's put all of our differentiation abilities to use  by analyzing the graphs of various functions. As you will see  the derivative and the second derivative of a function can tell us a lot about the function's graph.

title: Derivative applications
subject: AP Calculus AB
description: Solve real world problems (and some pretty elaborate mathematical problems) using the power of differential calculus.

title: Indefinite integrals
subject: AP Calculus AB
description: If f is the derivative of F  then F is an antiderivative of f. We also call F the "indefinite integral" of f. In other words  indefinite integrals and antiderivatives are  essentially  reverse derivatives. Why differentiate in reverse? Good question! Keep going and you'll find out!

title: Definite integrals introduction
subject: AP Calculus AB
description: Definite integrals are a way to describe the area under a curve. Make introduction with this intriguing concept  along with its elaborate notation and various properties.

title: Riemann sums
subject: AP Calculus AB
description: Riemann sums is the name of a family of methods we can use to approximate the area under a curve. Through Riemann sums we come up with a formal definition for the definite integral.

title: Fundamental theorem of calculus
subject: AP Calculus AB
description: So you've learned about indefinite integrals and you've learned about definite integrals. Have you wondered what's the connection between these two concepts? You will get all the answers right here. Beware  this is pretty mind-blowing.

title: Definite integral evaluation
subject: AP Calculus AB
description: Make your first steps in evaluating definite integrals  armed with the Fundamental theorem of calculus.

title: Integration techniques
subject: AP Calculus AB
description: Some functions don't make it easy to find their integrals  but we are not ones to give up so fast! Learn some advanced tools for integrating the more troublesome functions.

title: Area & arc length using calculus
subject: AP Calculus AB
description: Become a professional area-under-curve finder! You will also learn here how integrals can be used to find lengths of curves. The tools of calculus are so versatile!

title: Integration applications
subject: AP Calculus AB
description: As with derivatives  solve some real world problems and mathematical problems using the power of integral calculus.

title: Volume using calculus
subject: AP Calculus AB
description: Integrals can be used to find 2D measures (area) and 1D measures (lengths). But it can also be used to find 3D measures (volume)! Learn all about it here.

title: Differential equations
subject: AP Calculus AB
description: Differential equations are equations that include both a function and its derivative (or higher-order derivatives). For example  y=y' is a differential equation. Learn how to find and represent solutions of basic differential equations.

title: AP Calculus AB questions
subject: AP Calculus AB
description: Many of you are planning on taking the Calculus AB advanced placement exam.  These are example problems taken directly from previous years' exams. Even if you aren't taking the exam  these are very useful problem for making sure you understand your calculus (as always  best to pause the videos and try them yourself before Sal does).

title: Sequences & series intro
subject: AP Calculus BC
description: Sequences are like chains of ordered terms. Series are sums of terms in sequences. These simple innovations uncover a world of fascinating functions and behavior.

title: Series convergence & estimation
subject: AP Calculus BC
description: How can we tell whether a series converges or diverges? How can we find the value a series converges to? There is an impressive repository of tools that can help us with these questions. Learn all about it here.

title: Power series
subject: AP Calculus BC
description: Power series are infinite series of the form Σaₙxⁿ (where n is a positive integer). Even though this family of series has a surprisingly simple behavior  it can be used to approximate very elaborate functions.

title: Differential equations
subject: AP Calculus BC
description: Differential equations are equations that include both a function and its derivative (or higher-order derivatives). For example  y=y' is a differential equation. Learn how to find and represent solutions of basic differential equations.

title: AP Calculus BC questions
subject: AP Calculus BC
description: The Calculus BC AP exam is a super set of the AB exam.  It covers everything in AB as well as some of the more advanced topics in integration  sequences and function approximation.  This tutorial is great practice for anyone looking to test their calculus mettle!

title: Thinking about multivariable functions
subject: Multivariable calculus
description: The only thing separating multivariable calculus from ordinary calculus is this newfangled word "multivariable".  It means we will deal with functions whose inputs or outputs live in two or more dimensions.  Here we lay the foundations for thinking about and visualizing multivariable functions.

title: Derivatives of multivariable functions
subject: Multivariable calculus
description: What does it mean to take the derivative of a function whose input lives in multiple dimensions?  What about when its output is a vector?  Here we go over many different ways to  extend the idea of a derivative to higher dimensions  including partial derivatives​  directional derivatives  the gradient  vector derivatives  divergence  curl  etc.

title: Applications of multivariable derivatives
subject: Multivariable calculus
description: The tools of partial derivatives  the gradient  etc. can be used to optimize and approximate multivariable functions.  These are very useful in practice  and to a large extent this is why people study multivariable calculus.

title: Integrating multivariable functions
subject: Multivariable calculus
description: There are many ways to extend the idea of integration to multiple dimensions: Line integrals  double integrals  triple integrals  surface integrals  etc.  Each one lets you add infinitely many infinitely small values  where those values might come from points on a curve  points in an area  points on a surface  etc.    These are all very powerful tools  relevant to almost all real-world applications of calculus.  In particular  they are an invaluable tool in physics.

title: Green's Stokes' and the divergence theorems
subject: Multivariable calculus
description: Here we cover four different ways to extend the fundamental theorem of calculus to multiple dimensions.  Green's theorem and the 2D divergence theorem do this for two dimensions  then we crank it up to three dimensions with Stokes' theorem and the (3D) divergence theorem.

description: Understanding how we can map one set of vectors to another set.  Matrices used to define linear transformations.

title: Alternate coordinate systems (bases)
subject: Linear algebra
description: We explore creating and moving between various coordinate systems.

subject: Kindergarten
description: Learn how to count. Say how many objects you see.  Learn about teen numbers and how to break them up.

title: Addition and subtraction

description: Learn the basics of adding and subtracting.

title: Measurement and geometry
subject: Kindergarten
description: Learn how to compare objects based on their size.  Learn basic shapes  compare shapes  and use shapes to create new shapes.

description: We will learn about the ones and tens place values and compare 2-digit numbers.

title: Addition and subtraction
